official-title.#text:
To direct the Securities and Exchange Commission to
		  require that repurchase-to-maturity transactions be treated as secured
		  borrowings.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Keep Repos to Maturity on Balance
			 Sheet Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require that a repurchase-to-maturity
			 transaction be treated as a secured borrowing in which the transferred asset
			 serves as collateral.

text.#text:
In establishing
			 accounting principles or standards for purposes of the securities laws, the

a financial asset
			 is transferred in exchange for cash, other financial assets, or letters of
			 credit; and

concurrently with
			 the transfer, the transferor and the transferee agree that, at the maturity of
			 the transferred asset, the transferee may either, at the option of the
			 transferee—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , plus a stipulated interest factor; or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Keep Repos to Maturity on Balance Sheet Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:1/sp:A

text.#text:
return the
			 transferred asset (or a substantially similar asset) to the transferor, thereby
			 obligating the transferor to reacquire the transferred asset (or to acquire the
			 substantially similar asset, as the case may be) for an amount equal to the
			 value of the cash, other financial assets, or letters of credit described in

redeem the
			 transferred asset from the issuer of the transferred asset.

quote.#tail:
has the meaning
			 given such term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

quote.#tail:
means a financial
			 asset transferred in exchange for cash, other financial assets, or letters of
			 credit in a repurchase-to-maturity transaction, as described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Keep Repos to Maturity on Balance Sheet Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:1/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply beginning on the date that is 90 days after
			 the date of the enactment of this Act.
